entities.name: the pensieve
entities.description: A magical device used to store and recall memories. (The Pensieve is mentioned as a place where Harry's memories are stored.)

entities.name: lord voldemort
entities.description: The main antagonist of the story, a dark wizard who has taken over the wizarding world. (Lord Voldemort's downfall is mentioned in the context of Karkaroff's past actions.)

entities.name: karkaroff
entities.description: A Death Eater who has turned spy for Harry and Dumbledore. (Karkaroff is being questioned by Mr. Crouch in the context of his past actions as a Death Eater.)

entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: A wizard who is skeptical of Karkaroff's intentions. (Mad-Eye Moody is shown to be looking at Karkaroff with deep skepticism behind Dumbledore's back.)

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. (Dumbledore is mentioned in the context of his relationship with Mad-Eye Moody and Karkaroff.)

entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main protagonist of the story, a young wizard who is being questioned by Mr. Crouch. (Harry is shown to be looking around in confusion as the dungeon dissolves and reappears.)

entities.name: mr crouch
entities.description: A Ministry of Magic official who is questioning Karkaroff. (Mr. Crouch is shown to be coldly reviewing Karkaroff's case.)

entities.name: azkaban
entities.description: A maximum-security prison for wizards and witches. (Karkaroff is told that he will return to Azkaban in the meantime.)

relationships.description: Harry's memories are stored in the Pensieve. (The text mentions that Harry's memories are stored in the Pensieve, implying a relationship between Harry and the device.)

Karkaroff was a Death Eater of Lord Voldemort. (The text mentions that Karkaroff turned spy for Harry and Dumbledore after Lord Voldemort's downfall, implying a past relationship between Karkaroff and Voldemort.)
Mad-Eye Moody is skeptical of Karkaroff's intentions. (The text shows Mad-Eye Moody looking at Karkaroff with deep skepticism, implying a relationship between the two.)
Karkaroff is spying for Dumbledore. (The text mentions that Karkaroff turned spy for Harry and Dumbledore, implying a relationship between Karkaroff and Dumbledore.)
Karkaroff is spying for Harry. (The text mentions that Karkaroff turned spy for Harry and Dumbledore, implying a relationship between Karkaroff and Harry.)
Mr. Crouch is questioning Karkaroff. (The text shows Mr. Crouch coldly reviewing Karkaroff's case, implying a relationship between the two.)
Karkaroff will return to Azkaban. (The text mentions that Karkaroff is being told he will return to Azkaban, implying a relationship between Karkaroff and the prison.)
